title: Snowdonia Adventure Weekend
tagline: Zip lines, summit hikes, and gorge scrambling
suitableFor: Active families and groups of friends who enjoy outdoor adventures and are comfortable with moderate physical activity. Children should be at least 8 years old for most activities.
notSuitableFor: Individuals with significant mobility issues or a fear of heights. Those seeking a relaxing or luxurious getaway may find this itinerary too active.
packingEssentials: Hiking boots with good ankle support
Map and compass or GPS device (and know how to use them!)

stops.title: Velocity 2 Zip Line
stops.description: Experience the thrill of flying over Penrhyn Quarry on the world's fastest zip line. Enjoy breathtaking views as you reach speeds of over 100mph.

wetAlt.title: Bounce Below
wetAlt.description: Jump and explore giant trampolines in a disused slate mine. Fun for all ages, regardless of the weather.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Llyn Ogwen
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk around Llyn Ogwen, taking in the stunning mountain views. A great free activity.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A legendary cafe in Llanberis, famous for its hearty portions and climber-friendly atmosphere.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Padarn
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your packed lunch with a view of Llyn Padarn and the surrounding mountains.

stops.title: Llanberis Path Guided Walk (partial)
stops.description: Hike a section of the Llanberis Path, the easiest route to the summit of Snowdon. Enjoy the views without the full summit challenge, suitable for families. Turn back when feeling tired.

wetAlt.title: National Slate Museum
wetAlt.description: Learn about the history of the slate industry in North Wales at this fascinating museum. It's free!

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Padarn Country Park
budgetAlt.description: Explore the scenic Padarn Country Park, with views of the lake and mountains.

stops.title: YHA Snowdon Llanberis
stops.description: A comfortable and well-located hostel in Llanberis, ideal for exploring Snowdonia.

budgetAlt.title: The Snowdon Inn (Y Fricsan) Campsite
budgetAlt.description: A budget-friendly campsite in Llanberis, offering stunning views of Snowdon.

stops.title: Snowdon Summit Hike (Llanberis Path)
stops.description: Hike to the summit of Snowdon via the Llanberis Path, the easiest and most popular route. Enjoy panoramic views from the top (weather permitting).
stops.travelToNext: 15 min drive to restaurant in Capel Curig

wetAlt.title: Electric Mountain
wetAlt.description: Take a tour of the Dinorwig Power Station, a hydroelectric power station built inside a mountain.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Llyn Peris
budgetAlt.description: A flat and easy walk around Llyn Peris, with views of the mountains and the village of Llanberis.

stops.title: Moel Siabod Cafe
stops.description: A cosy cafe in Capel Curig, serving delicious homemade food and cakes.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch on the shores of Llyn Ogwen
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic with spectacular mountain views.

stops.title: Plas y Brenin
stops.description: A world-renowned national mountain centre, offering comfortable accommodation and a range of outdoor activities.

budgetAlt.title: Ben's Bunkhouse
budgetAlt.description: A budget-friendly bunkhouse in Nant Peris, close to many hiking trails.

stops.title: Gorge Walking
stops.description: Experience the thrill of scrambling through a natural gorge, climbing waterfalls, and swimming in plunge pools with Adventure Britain.

wetAlt.title: National White Water Centre - spectator visit
wetAlt.description: Watch the white water rafting action from the river bank cafe at the National White Water Centre.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Bala Lake
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk along the shores of Bala Lake, the largest natural lake in Wales.

stops.title: White Lion Royal Hotel
stops.description: A traditional pub in Bala, serving hearty Welsh food and local ales.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic by Bala Lake
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own provisions with a beautiful view.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Snowdonia's weather can be unpredictable, even in summer. Be prepared for rain, wind, and sunshine all in one day. Check the forecast before you go and pack accordingly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy, especially during peak season. Allow extra time for travel, especially on the A5 and A470. Parking at popular spots like Pen-y-Pass and Llanberis fills up quickly, so arrive early or use public transport.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for Zip World activities and recommended for guided walks and accommodation, particularly during school holidays.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary requires a moderate level of fitness. The Snowdon hike is challenging, and gorge walking involves scrambling and swimming. Make sure you are prepared for the physical demands of the activities.
